definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive , nautical ) To make (a rope ) fast by turning it around a fastening point such as a cleat .
( transitive , climbing ) To handle a climbing rope to prevent (a climber) from falling to the ground .
examples: He would need an experienced partner to belay him on the difficult climbs.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To lay aside ; to stop ; to cancel .
examples: I could only hope the remaining piton would belay his fall.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , nautical ) The general command to stop or cease .
( transitive , obsolete ) To surround ; to environ ; to enclose .
( transitive , obsolete ) To overlay ; to adorn .
( transitive , obsolete ) To besiege ; invest ; surround .
( transitive , obsolete ) To lie in wait for in order to attack; block up or obstruct .
